newsitem.title: USA: Polaris Industries off on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Polaris Industries off on profit-taking.

text.p: Hit by profit-taking, shares in Polaris Industries Inc closed off 2 at 30-1/4 on the New York Stock Exchange in abbreviated trading Thursday.
Light volume suggested to analysts there was no major move against the stock of the maker of snowmobiles, all-terrain vehicles, personal watercraft and motorcycles.
"It may just be some profit-taking," said John G. Kinnard analyst Saul Yaari. "I don't think there's any fundamental reason for it. Polaris is a really good story."
Shares in the Minneapolis-based company have climbed to the low 30s from the low 20s since April.
"I continue to be very enthusiastic about the company," said Smith Barney analsyt Gerald Odening.
